content.description:
Extremely steep and gymnastic roof climbing flanked by an easier start and finish. 

  Do the same start as Medial Tear, but clip a draw to the left.  Pull over the roof, then head left along slopers and edges until you reach the horizontal break below the 45 degree headwall.  Get spread out on some good sidepulls and then spring for a huge jug.  A few more hard moves gets you to a vertical wall with much easier climbing to the top.
content.protection: Bolts and a two bolt anchor.  This route is completely fixed with old quickdraws.
content.location: On the right side of the Bunker.  Just left of Medial tear.  The middle route out the roof.  Follows a faint seam.

content.description: Climb up to a left-facing corner and encounter the boggling crux moves.  Move past this and up the fantastic and mellow headwall to the top.
content.location: Bring your knee pad for this one.

content.description: A crimpy reachy start leads to fun 5.11 climbing above.
content.location: This route starts in the blocky corner just to the right of soldier on.

content.description: Climb the steep face past a short corner.  A couple of long pulls and finish up in a high corner.
Stick clip the route just right of 1554. Boulder out of the roof and gun it for the anchors through 60 or 70 feet of amazing jug hauling.
content.protection: 6 bolts and anchors. Optional belay bolts if you don't belay from the ground that double as a directional to keep the rope out of the way for the first boulder problem.
content.location: This route starts on the Hanger ledge, just right of 1554.

content.description: Begin with the steep bouldery start before pulling the tiered roofs and finishing up with an increasingly easy face.
Climb the roof with a little seam and up through a couple of tiers to the wall above with anchors just under a triangular block hanging over the top of the cliff.
Aid up to the first bolt to get to epic, steep, jug hauling. This is the same climb as Escape from Auschwitz, minus the V8 boulder start.
Same start as All Business but continues up to superb climbing with long moves with good holds. "One of the best routes at the Obed or anywhere for that matter."

Start the same as Bottom Line and 420, but follow the right hand bolt line out the roof.  Pull over the lip using crimps and finish up the headwall with another hard move.  Note a fist jam in the roof and a knee bar to pull the lip may help out.
content.location: This is the right hand route that shares the start with The bottom Line and 420

content.description: Short bouldery route up the steep wall!

Very steep climbing out the prominent roof on the right side of the Bunker. 

  Stick clip the first bolt, then make some cool moves over the first roof to a vertical wall. Keep moving right along horizontal cracks to a slight corner below the 40 degree headwall. Steep, fun moves on decent holds bring you to a set of full-pad edges.  Make a big move to a slopey jug, and keep coasting right to a very good hold.  Gather your strength(if you can) and then make a few big pulls on big pinches and disappointing flat jugs to a good clipping jug below the anchors.
content.protection: Bolts and a two bolt anchor.  Most of the route is fixed with webbing slings with a carabiner.  However, the first two bolts are not equipped.
content.location: Just right of Trick Photography.  Look for the route with webbing draws.

content.description: Thin sustained climbing leads to a good rest before you have to head out the roof going to the anchors.
content.location: Stick clip the first 2 bolts, it keeps the rope out of the way.

content.description: Stick clip the first 2 bolts and aid up to the jug at the lip of the roof to start.  A tough starting move leads to Jugs. The final crux on the steepest part of the route revolves around some powerful underclings.

climbs.name: Industry Standard
climbs.fa: Bentley Brackett bolted by Mike McKee

content.description: Climb the steep face on the left side of the shelf and pull the tiered roofs.

Stick clip the first 2 staggered bolts! Climb out the short roof and get set up to do a long dynamic move to a bucket.  Pumpy climbing takes you to a little corner and a hard backhand move.  Easier climbing the rest of the way.
content.location: There is a fixed climb tech draw at the crux of this route.

content.description: Starts from the same rock pedestal as The Fossil but goes right out the roof.  Powerful sustained climbing coming out the roof to a dead point off of 2 really small edges.  Pumpy 11+ to the anchors.
content.location: This was bolted by Matt Beets and is a closed project.

content.description: Start from the rock pedestal and come straight out the roof. Powerful undercling and backhand moves coming out the roof. Once you're out from the roof, it's pumpy 5.11 climbing.
content.location: Stick clip the first 2 bolts in the roof.

content.description: Steep start on some smaller edges. Pumpy middle section with a slopey run to the anchors
content.location: stick clip the first bolt and the bolt down and right.  This will lee the rope out of the climbers way.

content.description: Pull the strange boulder moves up to the first bolt, then begin the steep 5.11 jug haul.
Starts with some hard crimp moves! Powerful backhand and side pull moves get you through the roof!
content.location: Starts just right of closed project!

content.description: Climb out the roof to a cruxy move.  Break slightly left and up past some tiers to a reachy move up hight.
content.location: This route and the next one start where the ledge is the narrowest.

content.description: Shares the start with standard issue but breaks right out the steep roof.  Good holds all the way till you start going to the anchors.
Sequential jugs to a stopper move getting over the roof.  This is Brian Jones route and it is a closed project.

This short, neglected route sits just left of the heavily chalked Alzheimer's On-Sight. 

  Climb an easy ramp to some good holds below the roof.  Follow some small edges up and right to better holds and then keep cranking between good but very spaced out holds to the top.   

  Despite the unattractive name, I didn't find any choss on this route.  However, I didn't find much fun on it either.
content.protection: Bolts and a two bolt anchor.  A 50 meter rope will easily get you down.
content.location: Just left of Alzheimer's On-Sight or the second route from the right off the large ledge.

content.description: Starts on industry standard but follows the right bolt line.  The first part of the route is fun jugs.  The crux is at the fixed draw.  One long move and pumpy climbing to the top.
Begin with a difficult boulder problem at the start of the roof, climb out the long roof with a big reach over the lip.  Finish up the great headwall to the top.
content.location: Starts to the right of the fossil and the hippie.

content.description: Connect a series of complex moves out the traversing 25 foot roof, which gradually trends toward the lip.  climb over the lip on crimps and climb the head wall.
content.location: This route starts the same as 420 and Quality Control but it goes way left.

content.description: This route climbs a very steep section of the wall through some blocks.  There are long reaches, hand jams, and jugs.
content.protection: Bring a couple quickdraws, the rest are fixed.  As of October '12, there are new fixed draws.
content.location: This route can be found on the right end of the Hanger ledge.

climbs.name: All Business
climbs.fa: Adam Sylvester bolted by Glenn Ritter

content.description: Start out the roof to the diagonal rail. Take care of business at the second bolt and move left at the third. Finish up the steep head wall.

This is the first route encountered on the right side of the ledge.  Climb up the short face to the 10-foot roof.  Make a long reach to the great undercling and then lunge for some good holds on the upper face.  Balance through the vertical face the the rest at the base of the upper roof.  Climb through the upper roof with jugs to the final black headwall.  Finish up the headwall on excellent uncut crimps to the anchors.
content.location: If walking across the ledge this is the first route you come up on.  It's where the ledge opens up again.

content.description: Long pulls on good holds coming out the roof!  The crux of the route is at the lip of the roof with a big move off of an undercling.  Still need to keep things together going out the top.
content.location: This route is the middle of three routes that start the same.  It actually has climb tech draws on it.

content.description: Climb past the corner and up a three tiered roof.

Turn the corner and you will find an amazing sight. The Hanger is located on a 30 ft. ledge that runs the length of the wall. The climbing is steep and amazing! Be careful and use the bolted cable on the sketchy areas.
